tasks.title: Fix dice number mismatch with roll result
tasks.description: When rolling the dice, the visual number shown on the dice face does not match the actual roll result. For example, first roll said to read the 4th comic but the d6 showed 5 spinning on the die face.
tasks.status_notes:
Claimed by Alice at 2026-01-04T14:30:35.733544+00:00
[2026-01-04T14:32:55.746392+00:00] Investigating dice number mismatch issue. Found that roll.html rollTheDie() uses client-side Math.random() for animation (line 164), while server generates actual result. Client-side animation values are random and independent of server result. After animation, HTMX response replaces the entire #result div with server-side correct value. Need to ensure dice animation shows server result, not random client values.
[2026-01-04T14:33:32.543340+00:00] Found root cause: rollTheDie() function was using client-side Math.random() to display random numbers on dice during animation (line 164). These values had no relationship to server-generated roll result. Fix: Removed the line that displayed random values during animation. Now dice only rotate during rolling without showing changing numbers. Final number is correctly displayed from server response when HTMX replaces the #result div.

tasks.title: Implement session save points and restore
tasks.description: Users must be able to restore their reading list and dice state to a known good point in time, especially after exploratory or demo usage.
tasks.instructions: Create an explicit "session start" save point when a reading session begins. Persist: Thread order, Active dice and ladder position, Roll pool. Add "Restore session start" action that fully reverts state. This should be a single atomic operation.

Updated undo_to_snapshot() in app/api/undo.py to restore session_state when present in snapshot. Updated snapshot_thread_states() in app/api/rate.py to capture session_state for consistency. tasks.instructions: Undo must revert entire app state to selected history entry. Ensure DB writes are transactional. If undo fails, surface an error instead of silently doing nothing.
